title: Galilee Basin gas JV could spark takeover interest
text:
Big energy players and investors' eyes will be firmly trained on Queensland's Galilee Basin over the next few months, to see whether two potential takeover targets take shape.

If a joint gas venture between Comet Ridge and Vintage Energy in the basin is successful, analysts and fund managers reckon the whether the likes of Santos, Senex and Beach Energy may start circling.

RBC's Ben Wilson thinks the Galilee Downs JV could supply the east coast gas market via a new pipeline. Michele Mossop

The Galilee Deeps JV (GDJV) is a gas field project in western Queensland. ASX-listed Comet Ridge owns a 70 per cent stake in it, while fellow microcap Vintage Energy holds the remainder.

Just this week, Comet Ridge and Vintage Energy told the market its Albany-1 well side-track had reached total depth of 2822 metres and strong gas shows were observed.

This follows up initial gas shows at its second well, Albany-2.
description: If Comet Ridge and Vintage Energy's joint venture in the Galilee Basin is a success, Santos, Senex and Beach Energy could start circling.
